data.name: strChkCheatDescriptionEasyMoney
data.value: Collected money pieces are worth much more cash.

data.name: strChkCheatDescriptionGodMode
data.value: enemy hits deal no damage on you.

data.name: strChkCheatDescriptionInfiniteItems
data.value: collected items are set to 50 units, and are never decreased.

data.name: strChkCheatDescriptionLevelUp
data.value: every enemy killed adds +100k EXP to the player.

data.name: strChkCheatDescriptionOneHitKillsAnimals
data.value: Kill animals (mooses and boars) with a single hit.

data.name: strChkCheatDescriptionOneHitKillsEnemies
data.value: Kill enemies and bosses with a single hit.

data.name: strHelpContentsHTML
data.value:
How do I use the trainer?

First, you should run the trainer and enable and configure all the cheats you want to enable. The available cheats are at the "Available hacks" area of the trainer's main window.

After configuring the cheats the way you want, just run the game. The trainer will automatically detect the game and apply the cheats you have configured. You may have to wait about 3 seconds for this process to happen.

Once the trainer is running and you are in the game, you can press ALT+TAB to go back to the trainer and you can reconfigure the trainer while the game is running — there's no problem in doing that, and the trainer will adjust the hack configurations inside the game accordingly.

In case of errors...

If nothing happens, or if you receive an error, first you need to check if both the game and the trainer are running. If so, check if you have the right version of the game that the trainer is compatible with. The game's compatible version appear after the Required game version label, in the trainer's main window (in the Game info area). The trainer will probably NOT work with another version of the game: it must be the specific version that is written on the trainer's interface!

In case there's any error, you might also try to run the trainer with elevated privileges. Find the trainer's program, right-click it and choose Run as administrator to try running the trainer with elevated privileges.

As a last resort, if the trainer fails to automatically find the running game, you might want to try to select the game's process manually. This process is not recommended, as it might cause the game to crash and/or data to be lost. If you are absolutely sure you want to do a manual selection, you might access that option through the menu on the trainer's main window: More options... > Select game process manually. This will open a window that lists all the processes running on your system, where you can try to find the target game's process.

Getting help

Here are some options on how you can get help for using this trainer.

Tooltips: in the trainer's interface, put your mouse cursor over the things you are confused about. A tooltip will appear describing the item your mouse is over.

Visit the project's website: you can try looking for help on the project's GitHub page. To see the list of official trainer projects built with the RAMvader library, click on this link.

Help the developer =)

To show your support for the developer, or maybe if you wish to keep the trainers/projects updated or want new trainers/projects to be released, consider donating to help the development!

There's a piggy bank button at the end of the trainer's main screen for receiving donations. Any amount would be greatly appreciated! =)

Thank you!

data.name: strLblNotAttached
data.value: Game not detected... Please, run the game!

data.name: strMenuItemSearchAutomatically
data.value: Search for the game's process automatically

data.name: strMsgConfirmDetachment
data.value:
The trainer is already attached to the game's process. Proceeding with this action will detach the trainer from the game's process.
Are you sure you want to detach the trainer from the game's process?

data.name: strMsgFailedToAttach
data.value: Failed to attach to the game's process! Do you want the trainer to continue trying to automatically attach to the game?

data.name: strToolTipDonateButton
data.value:
If you wish to support the developer, please click this button to help by making a donation. Your donation allows the developer to keep the projects updated and to make new ones.
This button opens a PayPal donation web page.

data.name: strToolTipLabelGameProcess
data.value:
Shows the process where the game has been detected. When you run the game, the trainer will automatically detect it and display its process here.
Although this is not recommended, you can manually select the game's process by going to the menu: More options > Select game process manually

data.name: strToolTipMenuItemHelp
data.value: Click for information on how to use the trainer.

data.name: strToolTipMenuItemManualAttachment
data.value: Stops trainer's "automatic detection" of the game, and lets you manually select the game's process. This is for advanced users only, and is NOT recommended.

data.name: strToolTipProcessesFilterField
data.value: Type here to filter the list of available processes below

data.name: strToolTipRequiredGameVersion
data.value: The version of the game this trainer is compatible with. If your game has a different version, this trainer will probably NOT work with it.

data.name: strToolTipRestartLookingForGame
data.value: If you have stoped the trainer from looking for the game, click here to make it restart the automatic searching.
